citeinfo.title: The StreamCat Dataset: Accumulated Attributes for NHDPlusV2 Streams and Catchments (Version 2.1) for the Conterminous United States: 2006 National Land Cover Database Agricultural Land Cover on Slopes

pubinfo.publish: US EPA Office of Research & Development (ORD) - National Health and Environmental Effects Research Laboratory (NHEERL)

descript.abstract:
This dataset represents data derived from the NLCD dataset and the National Hydrography Dataset version 2.1(NHDPlusV2) (see Data Sources for links to NHDPlusV2 data and NLCD). Attributes were calculated for every local NHDPlusV2 catchment and accumulated to provide watershed-level metrics for agricultural classes (classes 81 and 82) within the NLCD on DEM-derived slopes >10% and >20%.
This data set is derived from the NLCD raster composed of 16 land cover classes (categorical data type) for the conterminous USA. 2 classes were isolated to represent apricultural land cover. This raster was produced based on a decision-tree classification of circa 2006 Landsat satellite data.(see Data Structure and Attribute Information for a description of each metric).
Included with NHDPlusV2 is the National Elevation Dataset (NED) which was used to create 2 slope rasters to find areas with slope >10% and >20%. These rasters were used as masks to locate areas where NLCD agricultural classes (classes 81 and 82) occur on slopes >10% and >20%.
descript.purpose: These data were created in support of the US EPAâ€™s National Aquatic Resource Survey (NARS) and Safe and Sustainable Waters Resources (SSWR) Programs. However, these watershed summaries of landscape data should have broad applicability for hydrological, geomorphic, or ecological modeling, management, and restoration. For details on EPA NARS and SSWR Programs see http://water.epa.gov/type/watersheds/monitoring/aquaticsurvey_index.cfm and http://www.epa.gov/research/progressreport/water.htm
descript.supplinf:
All code and scripts used to produce these data were written in the python or R programming languages and are freely available at ftp://newftp.epa.gov/EPADataCommons/ORD/NHDPlusLandscapeAttributes/StreamCat/Documentation/Code/
Glossary of Terms
Stream Segment: NHDPlusV2 line describing a section of contiguous stream or river between upstream and downstream tributaries (as depicted in USGS topographic quadrangles), except where the segment is a headwater or terminal stream .
Catchment (Cat): The portion of the landscape where surface flow drains directly to an NHDPlusV2 stream segment, excluding any upstream contributions.
Watershed (Ws): The set of hydrologically-connected catchments, consisting of all upstream catchments that contribute flow to any local catchment.
COMID: Unique identifier for each stream segment, and associated catchment, in NHDPlusV2. Watershed metrics describe entire area of all catchments that accumulate to the specific catchment based on the NHD PlusFlow table.
Riparian Buffer (Rp100): Spatial buffer of 100-m that was added to NHDPlusV2 stream network and NLCD water pixels. The buffers were used to spatially constrain calculations for some landscape metrics to within 100 meters of the riparian area.
Landscape Layer: Any geospatial layer from which we derived statistical summaries for both local catchments and watersheds. These landscape layers were comprised of several GIS formats, including vector (points, lines, or polygons) and raster.

idinfo.useconst: None. While EPA has used its best efforts to include complete and accurate information in the EME, EPA cannot be held responsible

procstep.procdesc: Datasets downloaded from http://www.mrlc.gov/nlcd06_data.php and http://www.horizon-systems.com/NHDPlus/NHDPlusV2_data.php Data source, date, units and resolution were recorded in a project tracking spreadsheet and verified (LR)
Projection of datasets verified as USGS Albers Equal Area Conic and projected as such if necessary

Performed a visual inspection of datasets for gaps, edges other anomalous features. Verified how no-data values were represented and recoded values as no-data where appropriate (for instance, if no-data locations represented by 0's or -9999, these were converted to no-data values).

Create a slope raster using the NEDSnapshot data included with NHDPlusV2 and classify slopes in 2 categories (1. greater than or equal to 10%, 2. greater than or equal to 20%). Rasters used as a mask for the creation of AgGt10PctSlp and AgGt20PctSlp landscape layers.

Ran zonal statistics python script (StreamCat.py) to calculate zonal statistics for all NHDPlusV2 catchments in each NHDPlusV2 Vector Processing Unit (VPU). Zonal statistics were performed using either ZonalStatisticsAsTable, TabulateArea, or spatially joining vector point data to catchments. Each method applies to the type of landscape layer being evaluated, Continuous, Categorical, or Point. We also calculated the percent of each catchment that had coverage by a given landscape layer (i.e. was not null). These results are accumulated using the NHDPlusV2 flow table to summarize upstream catchment values and complete watershed values for the metric.

Clean and standardize results of zonal statistics table from accumulation script / process (makeFinalTables.py). Clean up consisted of calculating mean value of metric per zone, renaming and sorting zonal statistics fields, and writing zonal results to .csv file.

pubinfo.publish: Fry, J., Xian, G., Jin, S., Dewitz, J., Homer, C., Yang, L., Barnes, C., Herold, N., and Wickham, J.

citeinfo.origin: United States Geological Survey (USGS) and US EPA
citeinfo.title: National Hydrography Dataset Plus

enttyp.enttypd: Percent of the NHDPlusV2 local catchment (Cat) and accumulated watershed (Ws) composed of agricultural classes (classes 81 and 82) within the NLCD on DEM-derived slopes >10% and >20%

attr.attrdef: Unique ID label to each catchment in NHDPlusV2
Area of the catchment measured in square kilometers.
Percent of the catchment that is covered by the landscape raster.
Area of the watershed measured in square kilometers.
Percent of the watershed that is covered by the landscape raster.
Percent agricultural land cover (classes 81 and 82)of the catchment area classified by the NLCD2006 landscape raster where slope is equal to or greater than 20%.
Percent agricultural land cover (classes 81 and 82) of the catchment area classified by the NLCD2006 landscape raster where slope is greater than 10%.
Percent agricultural land cover (classes 81 and 82) of the watershed area classified by the NLCD2006 landscape raster where slope is greater than 10%.
Percent agricultural land cover (classes 81 and 82) of the watershed area classified by the NLCD2006 landscape raster where slope is greater than 10%.
